title: Bug 19651: Team menu disappears from Hierarchy and Packages view
description: Team menu is not visible in the step 9. Note: TestClass.java is not in any CVS repository but I first saw the problem with a file managed by CVS.
OB: In step 9, the team menu is visible in the package view for the TestClass.
EB: In step 11, after selecting the word InnerClass in the text editor and pressing F4, the team menu is not visible in the new hierarchy view. Similarly, in step 13, after selecting the word TestClass in the new text editor and pressing F4, the team menu is not visible, although it should be as it is not an inner class. Additionally, in step 15, after selecting the TestClass in the package view and opening the popup menu, the team menu is no longer visible.
SR: Bug 19651: Team menu should be visible in the Hierarchy and Packages view. Build F2 Steps: 1) Open Eclipse with a new workspace. 2) Switch to the Java perspective and close the resource perspective. 3) Create a Java project named 'TestProject'. 4) Create a Java class named 'TestClass'. 5) Paste the provided code into the TestClass file and save it. 6) Change the preference for WorkbenchPerspective to open perspective in a new window. 7) Change the preference for Java to 'Open a new Type Hierarchy Perspective'. 8) Exit the workbench and restart it. 9) Select the TestClass (the class, not the unit) in the package view and open the popup menu. The team menu should be visible (although disabled). 10) Exit the workbench and restart it. 11) Select the word InnerClass in the text editor and press F4. Open the popup menu in the new hierarchy view. The team menu should not be visible since it is an inner class. 13) Select the word TestClass in the new text editor and press F4. The team menu should be visible since it is not an inner class. 14) There should be 3 opened windows. Close the two new windows. 15) Select the TestClass in the package view and open the popup menu. The team menu should not be visible anymore.
